title: Novels and Novellas about Nobility of Spirit
main_text:
My own heroes are the dreamers, those men and women who tried to make the world a better place than when they found it, whether in small ways or great ones. Some succeeded, some failed, most had mixed results… but it’s the effort that's heroic, as I see it. Win or lose, I admire those who fight the good fight. George R. R. Martin

Rip Van Winkle by Washington Irvine

Captain Burle by Emile Zola

Alyosha the Pot by Leo Tolstoy

My Life: The Story of a Provincial by Anton Chekhov

The Three Strangers by Thomas Hardy

Ivan the Fool by Leo Tolstoy

Siddhartha by Hermann Hesse

The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy

The Age of Innocence by Edith Wharton

The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Mansfield Park by Katherine Mansfield

The Lagoon by Joesph Conrad

Dance of Death by Guastave Flaubert

Happy Prince by Oscar Wilde

Don Quixote by Miguel de Cervantes

The Man in the Iron Mask by Alexandre Dumas

A Little Princess by Frances Hodgson Burnett

Gone With the Wind by Margaret Mitchel

The Hound of the Baskervilles by Arthur Conan Doyle

The Road Not Taken by Robert Frost

'A Tryst with Destiny' by Jawaharlal Nehru

Rocking Horse Winner by D.H. Lawrence

Odyssey by Homer

Angel in the Grave by Edith Wharton
